description: Factory presets that ship with the Pattern Generator - curated mathematically significant parameter combinations

presets.name: Classic Lorenz
presets.description: Edward Lorenz's original parameters (σ=10, ρ=28, β=8/3) - the classic butterfly attractor that launched chaos theory.
presets.mathematicalSignificance: Historical parameters that first demonstrated deterministic chaos

presets.name: Pre-Chaos Boundary
presets.description: Near the Hopf bifurcation (ρ≈24.737) where the system transitions from stable fixed points to chaos.
presets.mathematicalSignificance: Demonstrates the boundary between order and chaos

presets.name: Enhanced Chaos
presets.description: Higher ρ value creates more complex chaotic behavior with enhanced visual effects enabled.
presets.mathematicalSignificance: Shows how parameter changes affect attractor complexity

presets.name: Classic Thomas
presets.description: René Thomas's cyclically symmetric attractor at the standard chaotic parameter (b=0.208).
presets.mathematicalSignificance: Demonstrates cyclic symmetry in chaotic systems

presets.name: Hopf Bifurcation
presets.description: At the Hopf bifurcation point (b≈0.329) where stable limit cycles emerge before chaos onset.
presets.mathematicalSignificance: Critical point where periodic behavior transitions to chaos

presets.name: Enhanced Structure
presets.description: Lower b value reveals more complex attractor structure with enhanced visualization.
presets.mathematicalSignificance: Shows how dissipation parameter affects attractor geometry

presets.name: Classic Aizawa
presets.description: Standard Aizawa parameters creating the characteristic spherical attractor with tube structure.

presets.name: Critical Boundary
presets.description: Near the critical value (a≈0.932) where equilibrium points transition from real to complex.
presets.mathematicalSignificance: Critical parameter where system dynamics fundamentally change

presets.name: Enhanced Complexity
presets.description: Modified parameters creating enhanced structural complexity with parameter-based coloring.
presets.mathematicalSignificance: Demonstrates rich parameter space of six-dimensional system

presets.name: Compact Form
presets.description: Parameter combination creating a more compact, dense attractor structure.
presets.mathematicalSignificance: Shows how parameter tuning affects spatial distribution

presets.name: Classic Halvorsen
presets.description: Standard Halvorsen parameters (a=1.4) creating the characteristic cyclically symmetric attractor.
presets.mathematicalSignificance: Demonstrates cyclic symmetry with quadratic nonlinear terms

presets.name: Enhanced Chaos
presets.description: Lower damping parameter creates more complex chaotic behavior with enhanced visualization.
presets.mathematicalSignificance: Shows how reduced damping increases attractor complexity

presets.name: Stability Boundary
presets.description: Near the stability boundary where the system exhibits dramatic structural changes.
presets.mathematicalSignificance: Critical parameter region where attractor structure becomes highly sensitive

presets.name: Compact Structure
presets.description: Higher damping creates a more controlled, compact attractor form.
presets.mathematicalSignificance: Demonstrates how increased damping constrains chaotic dynamics

presets.name: Classic Newton-Leipnik
presets.description: Standard Newton-Leipnik parameters (a=0.4, b=0.175) creating the characteristic butterfly-wing structure.
presets.mathematicalSignificance: Classic parameters demonstrating cross-coupling dynamics and butterfly structure formation

presets.name: Critical Boundary
presets.description: Near critical parameter values where the butterfly structure exhibits enhanced folding complexity.
presets.mathematicalSignificance: Parameter region where cross-coupling terms create maximum structural complexity

presets.name: Enhanced Butterfly
presets.description: Optimized for butterfly visualization with enhanced particle density and shader effects.
presets.mathematicalSignificance: Parameters selected to maximize visual clarity of folding dynamics and wing structure

presets.name: Compact Wings
presets.description: Higher parameter values create more constrained butterfly wings with tighter folding patterns.
presets.mathematicalSignificance: Demonstrates how parameter changes affect wing span and folding characteristics
